description: Variation of conditions 4 (hours of operation) to allow the marquee to be used from 10am rather than midday, 13 (playing of music) to allow playing of music until 11.59pm, 23 (length of time) to increase duration from 6 months to 8 months between March and October and 1 month between November and January (as is currently), 24 (number of events) to allow the increase the number of major events from 3 to 4 on the rear lawn. Allow an additional partner event within the Estate to bolster our income and also allow us to showcase the House and Estate of planning permission 00176/E/P31 to allow for Chiswick House marquee renewal and amendment of operating times Public event allowance following planning permission 00176/E/P31 dated 05/11/2015
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The marquee and four major public events hereby permitted shall end by 16th December 2023.
Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Unnumbered site plan. Received: 27/11/2020. Chiswick House - Marquee Layout, Chiswick House Gable Elevation, Unnumbered photographs (x3). Received: 10/12/2020. Essential Regulations for Large Public Events Received: 10/02/2021) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 4 - The temporary marquee hereby permitted shall not be used outside of the following times Monday - Sundays 10.00am - 12:00am.

Condition : 5 - All daily and weekly deliveries and collections from Chiswick House and Chiswick House Caf?, including refuse collection must be made between the hours of 8am and 10.30am and abide by the safety routes on the plan submitted.

Condition : 6 - No demolition of construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8.00am to 6.00pm on Mondays to Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - The submitted scheme for protecting the surrounding area from noise from the marquee and the caf? shall be carried out as approved Scheme for protecting the surrounding area from noise from the marquee and caf?, Application Letter, received 13/10/08 and email received from Pollution Control 10/08/10 and all works which form part of the scheme shall be completed before (any part of) the noise-sensitive development(s) is occupied.

Condition : 8 - The submitted landscaping scheme (A3 booklet entitled Chiswick House and Gardens Planning Condition 8 and A4 booklet entitled Landscape Specification for Site Wide Landscape Works (excluding Caf? Contract Area) Rev A received 22/02/08 shall be carried out as approved.
Condition : 9 - All works to trees shall be carried out to BS Specification 3998 (As Amended).

Condition : 10 - The samples hereby submitted (Drawing Numbers A3 booklet entitled Chiswick House and Gardens Planning Condition 8 and A4 booklet entitled Landscape Specification for Site Wide Landscape Works (excluding Cafe Contract Area) Rev A received 22/02/08.Nidagravel brochure, walking and decking filcris brochures, netlon advanced turf brochures, formpave brochure, D105961 1, 2, D105961/FI/007 B, 008,009 D, 011, D105961/FC/021, D105961/FH/027 A, received 22/02/08.D105961/CFD/101 Rev C, 102 Rev C, 103, 104 Rev B,  D105961/CFH/001 Rev C, 002 Rev B,  D105961/CFR/001 Rev A, 002 Rev A, D105961/CFS/001 Rev B, D105961/CFS/002, D105961/CFW/001 Rev B, 002 Rev A, 003, D105961/CFD/001, 002, 003, 004, 005, 007, 008, 009, 010, 01, 012, 013, 014, 015, 016, 017, 018, 019, 020, 021, 022, 023, 024, 025, 026, received 17/06/08) shall be carried out as approved.

Condition : 11 - Any vehicle operating for commercial purposes to support hospitality and events within the sites operating hours (7am -1am) must be restricted to 5 miles per hour and abide by the safety routes shown on the plan submitted.

Condition : 12 - All excavations in preparation of foundations and drainage and all works above ground level in the immediate vicinity of trees to be retained shall be carried out in a manner to ensure that all major roots that are uncovered shall be retained and foundations bridged around them, and all major branches shall also be retained unless the Local Planning Authority otherwise agrees in writing, such works to be carried out to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 13 - No playing of musical instruments or operation of sound amplification equipment shall take place in any part of the premises open to the public, before 10am, nor after 11.30pm, on any day/ at any time so as to be audible outside the premises.

Condition : 14 - The developer shall prevent any mud, dirt of debris being carried on to the adjoining highway as a result of the site construction works. Details of such preventive measures shall be carried out as approved on the Method Statement received 17/03/08. The facilities so provided shall be maintained thereafter and used whenever the said operations are carried out.

Condition : 15 - That the function car parking area in the Northern Walled Garden, as shown on the plan submitted shall be used exclusively for special events and for function parking associated with the marquee unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 16 - No development shall take place until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work, in accordance with a written scheme of investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 17 - The landscape management plan submitted (Chiswick House and Gardens Management and Maintenance Plan, Volume 1 - Background, Context and the Business Plan and appendices, Volume 2 - Proposed Management and Maintenance and appendices, received 16/12/08) shall be carried out as approved.

Condition : 18 - The details of disabled access submitted (Chiswick House and Gardens Developing Access, Interpretation and Learning Plan, Wayfinding drawing package received 27/10/10) shall be carried out as approved.
Condition : 19 - The Marquee area should not be used until details regarding the design and colour of the marquee have been submitted to an approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 20 - The details and specific location of the play equipment as submitted (Drawing Numbers D105961/FD/139 REV A, D015961/PA/001, 002, 003 received 18/08/09) shall be carried out as approved.
Condition : 21 - The wildlife protection plan (Ecological Action Plan and Assessment of Ecological Impacts received 16/12/08) shall be carried out as approved.
Condition : 22 - The marquee hereby granted shall be operational for a limited period expiring on 16/12/2023 when the use shall cease.

Condition : 23 - For the duration of this permission, the marquee shall only be in place for no more than 8 calendar months between March and October and no more than one calendar month between November and January in each rolling year. Following each of these periods it shall be dismantled and the area beneath laid out in a manner, which has been submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 24 - No more than 4 major public events, including firework displays, gourmet fairs or homes and gardens shows shall be held on the rear lawn in any one calendar year.

Condition : 25 - The submitted details of lighting and street furniture (Drawing Numbers D105961/FI/008, 009, MEP/E, Drainage, Water and Electrical Services document and Electrical Services Specification rev A, D105961/FI/011, D105961/FD/021, D015961/FH/016, 022 and 025, D105961/FH027, Landscape Contract: Landscape Specification rev A, Cafe Contract: Landscape Specification section Q50 received 22/02/08) shall be carried out as approved.
